author: Staff Reporter
text:
The police on Thursday arrested nine persons who staged a drama that cash totalling Rs. 40.75 lakh and 30-sovereign jewellery were robbed by a gang on Wednesday.

Ravi (41), of Thanjavur, along with Sampath, Jeyachandran, Mariyappan and Hariharan lodged a complaint with Namakkal police that the cash and jewellery they were carrying were robbed by unidentified persons near Kuppampalayam, on Tiruchi Main Road. Ravi sustained injuries and was admitted to the hospital. However, inquiries revealed that the five along with four of their accomplices staged a drama that the money was robbed. Inquiries revealed that they carried ‘hawala’ money from Singapore to Bengaluru in a flight in October last to be handed over to a person in their native.

While nearing Hosur, the gang that gave them the money in Singapore attacked them and took the amount. The five lodged a compliant with the local police who recovered the money. The court on Wednesday ordered the money and the jewellery to be handed over to the five. They received the money and were on their way to their native. While on the way, they hatched a plan to swindle the money. They handed over the money to four of their accomplices and staged the drama that they were robbed. The police recovered the money and sent them to prison.
title: Nine held for staging ‘robbery’ drama
